meanings.definition: To cancel or annul a contract or agreement.
meanings.sent1: She decided to rescinder the lease agreement due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent2: The company had to rescinder the partnership deal after discovering hidden clauses.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to rescinder the contract with a flick and a wave.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury rescindered any hope of the outdoor event taking place.
meanings.sent5: The judge's gavel fell, resonating the rescinder of the marriage vows.

meanings.definition: The act of revoking or voiding a legal document.
meanings.sent1: The rescinder of the will left the family in disbelief.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer filed the rescinder with the court to officially revoke the agreement.
meanings.sent3: The rescinder of the contract was framed on the office wall as a reminder.
meanings.sent4: The rescinder of the deed was a weight lifted off their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The rescinder of the permit caused delays in the construction project.
